text: Edmonde Charles-Roux (17 April 1920 - 20 January 2016) was a French writer. She was born in Neuilly-sur-Seine, Hauts-de-Seine. In 1946, she joined the staff of a magazine being created, a women's weekly: Elle, where she spent two years. From 1948, she worked for the French edition of Vogue, becoming the magazineâ€™s editor-in-chief in 1954. Charles-Roux died on 20 January 2016, in Marseille, France, at the age of 95. ==References== ==Other websites== *"Edmonde Charles-Roux", Academie Goncourt Category:1920 births Category:2016 deaths Category:French journalists Category:Writers from Hauts-de-Seine Category:People from Neuilly-sur-Seine
title: Edmonde Charles-Roux
